meta.description: Cathay Pacific The Pier Business Class Lounge at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Cathay Pacific The Pier Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level 5, entrance near Gate 65 on Level 6

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description: Welcome to The Pier, Cathay Pacific's premium lounge at the Hong Kong International Airport. Located on Level 5 near Gates 62-66, The Pier covers over 3900 square meters, and features a Tea House, relaxation room, and 14 shower suites.

reviews.content: Great bartender. Several nice seating areas. Wish food was self-service instead of having to take a buzzer. Could have more vege options.
Horrible experience.  Person snoring so loud that you could not talk to the person next to you.  Staff REFUSED to wake the person, even after my two attempts, claiming he had a right to snore.
Definitely worth the visit. Spacious, comfortable and outstanding service. Right up with the best lounges. Various locations to suit any need during your visit.

I thought I’d been to some good lounges before, but this one takes the giddy biscuit, as Bertie Wooster would say. All my favourite things - tea, noodles, juices, yoga, daybeds, Aesop toiletries!!!!!!
One of the most beautiful business class lounges I’ve ever been to. Spacious and comfortable with a large selection of food and drinks.
I've been to the Wing several times, and I like both lounges (when they're not crowded). The Wing has an open, airy feeling, while the Pier has way more amenities and space to accommodate everyone.
Without a doubt the best of business lounges in HK. Sencha green tea and Ramen, Aesop amenities in granite showers, comfy places to sleep. I could live here!
Very average for a business lounge. The showers are very nice, other than that I was served a cold breakfast. Coffee OK. Not what I expected.
Truly an off the hook lounge. Great rest area for a nap. Multiple types of food. Tea room for culture class. Great staff. The only thing I’d do differently is have premium liquor in the bar.
They downgraded the Moet to Mumms. Henriot rosé in the first class lounge is much much better. Avoid!
Seriously nice lounge. Views, lots of space. Tea house, noodle house. It’s pretty perfect for lounging between flights.
One of the nicest lounges I have been to (I think it's better than EK business lounge in DXB). Variety of sitting areas (quiet, not so quiet), good F&B, and great service.
Possibly the best lounge I have been to yet. Huge space. Lots on offer. Quiet and relaxing. Love the tearoom.
One of my favourite business class only lounges in the world, it’s not too flashy but it’s very tasteful and puts me at ease before a flight (which is good in amongst the chaos that is HKG!).
Though less homely than the First Class Lounge next door, I actually prefer this lounge. The Noodle Bar, the Tea Room, the Breakfast Room, and the Bar made it more lively without being overbearing.
Amazing open space continues forever. The food selection is off the charts. And no comfort is spared. This is why I'm OW loyal.
This is one of the most luxurious business class lounges I have visited. Separate areas for different styles of eating and lovely showers. Cannot be faulted.
Spacious lounge, great amenities. Worth the walk if you have time to visit. Sit-down dining with table service and an interesting menu.
The sanctuary area is now closed except for fiest class passengers, even though it is empty
Wow! What a lounge! This place is massive and is worth the walk! After going to this lounge, I won't go anywhere else as it's not nearly as crowded and there's great food and amenities.
Amazing lounge, the space, privacy, food, shower are superb. Very cozy.
Undeniably the best lounge that I've been to in my travels. Amazing amenities and soothing decor that reminds you more like your home rather than an airport lounge.
Well done Cathay! I used to avoid this lounge but not anymore.
Simply stunning for a business class lounge. Better than The Wing.
Wow! Absolutely zero complaints. If you are on this side of the airport, The Pier is the lounge to visit. The Bridge is close by, but the Pier is much quieter and nicer IMHO.
Amazing lounge! Very spacious, wonderful amenities. Showers are available. Wifi quite fast, measured 20 Mbps up/down speeds via the Speedtest app.
As previous reviewers have said....awesome lounge. But don't tell anyone as it'll get too busy....sshhh.
Outstanding selection of food, amenities and seating - check out the tea house and noodle bar in particular!
Simply the best lounge I have visited so far!
Better than most premium hotel lounges. Makes my long layover much more comfortable.
One of the best around. Aesop products in showers. Quiet meditation rooms. Dan dan noodles. Tea service. Can't beat it.
Without doubt, the best business or premium lounge I've used. Fantastic wide selection of food and drink set out in a lovely relaxing environment with friendly staff. Fantastic showers too.
Pure bliss. Basically one long room split into 4 sections getting quieter as you move back. Wonderful experience. Love the coffee cart, wish they did take-outs.
Best and biggest of the CX lounges at HKIA - frankly we were disappointed with the Wing and Cabin (too crowded for one thing) but we are very happy here at the gorgeous spacious Pier.
Very clean, great F&B offerings. Friendly staff.
Love the new Pier, decor, shower, everything, my new favorite CX lounge at HKG airport, love my version of Dan Dan mien with crushed peanuts, shallots and green onion.
Definetly my pick of the lounges.
Wow, what can I say? Everything is 5 star. Will definitely come back on my way back to Sydney.
A beautifully designed space with good food, magazines etc. A very enjoyable place to relax before flying.
Two words: game changer. This is probably the best business lounge I have been in. New CX style with extensive seating, food and drinks. A huge lounge that feels like your living room. #1 in HKG.
Probably my new favorite business class lounge anywhere. Just visited a few days after it opened. Huge multi room facility with tea room, noodle bar, etc. CX really did great with this one!
